SUMMARY: AllS, allantoin , transcriptional activator participates in controlling genes involved in utilization of allantoin as a nitrogen source. Although AllS binding does not depend on presence of allantoin, this compound appears to be necessary for activation, perhaps by interacting with AllS [12460564]. AllS belongs to LysR family of transcriptional regulators, and like or members of this family, it has a putative helix-turn-helix motif in N-terminal domain [12460564]. Expression of allS gene is negligible under aerobic conditions and is increased under anaerobic conditions in presence of glyoxylate or allantoin. In absence of its repressor, AllR, allS is expressed under nitrogen-limiting growth conditions, but its induction is independent of regulators Nac and NtrC, which are active under se conditions [12460564].
